text: and i’d choose you; in a hundred lifetimes, in a hundred worlds, in any version of reality, i’d find you and i’d choose you.

no one is watching.
so why does it have to be beautiful?
you, in pain, are no closer to god than
you, in the drive thru or
you, checking your email or
you, holding your own hand.

for weeks now, driving, or dropping a bag of groceries in the street, the bag breaking,
i’ve been thinking: this is what the living do.
in the dream i don’t tell anyone, you put your head in my lap.

i wish that without me your heart would break
yeah, i wish that without me you’d be spending the rest of your nights awake
i wish that without me you couldn’t eat
yeah, i wish i was the last thing on your mind before you went to sleep

the rest of the day was quite easy.
i did all the jobs on my list
and enjoyed them and had some time over.
i love you. i'm glad i exist.

and
always embrace things, people earth
sky stars,
listen, are you breathing just a little, and calling it a life?

this poem goes on too long because our friendship has been long, long for this life and these times, long as art is long and uninterruptible, and i would make it as long as i hope our friendship lasts if i could make poems that long
keep busy with survival. imitate the trees. learn to lose in order to recover, and remember that nothing stays the same for long, not even pain, psychic pain. sit it out. let it all pass. let it go.

so today, i will wear my white button-down
i can at least be neat
walk out and be seen as clean

dear friend i’m lonesome,
dear friend i’ve been well
in the dream i am always posthumous, the sole survivor of myself
i’ve been sitting here thinking about flowers and sunshine and the happiness of being alive, which means i’m thinking of you and the waters and the mountains and the plenty of wide open sky.
i kneel into a dream where i am good and loved. i am good. i am loved. my hands have made some good mistakes. they can always make better ones.

i remember love, despite everything.
if anything remains in that place, it can only be love.
...the world was made so that we could find each other in it.

i know that there’s something residing,
a terror deep inside me
i couldn’t understand how you could be so bold!

i don’t pay attention to the world ending.
it has ended for me
many times
and began again in the morning.
but it’s no use; you always kill at least a few skiers a year, just to remind them to be fearful.

anything that is beautiful people want to break
and you are beautiful, i’m afraid
but how heavy is my happiness that no sound on earth can encompass it?
just close your eyes. i will still be here when you open them again.

to save
what i hope will still be me

i wish i was your favorite girl
i wish you thought i was the reason you are in the world
i wish my smile was your favorite kind of smile
i wish the way that i dressed was your favorite kind of style
if i said please, would you stick around?
every day i am so sleepy. i yawn all the time. but my pillow is soft and welcoming, and my friend.
i want to know… do i dance inside your head?
you will dream of being a girl’s body turned to air.
it really hurts me to see you suffering this much and being unable to do anything about it.

i, i, i, i want to walk in the snow
and not leave a footprint
i, i, i, i want to walk in the snow
and not soil its purity
i love this world, even in its hard places. a bird too must love this world, even in its hard places. so, even if the effort may come to nothing, you have to do something.

you know it’s good to be tough like me
but i will wait forever
i need someone else
to look into my eyes and tell me
“girl, you know you’ve got to watch your health”
for old times’ sake is actually such a heartbreaking and beautiful sentiment. let’s do it for the love that used to be here! it is reason enough!
sometimes i hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives i’m not living.
...it will break your heart? leaving us behind will hurt you that much?

i treat myself like i would my daughter. i brush her hair, wash her laundry, tuck her in goodnight. most importantly, i feed her. i do not punish her. i do not berate her, leave tears staining her face. i do not leave her alone. i know she deserves more. i know i deserve more.
if i have the destruction of something that i once loved to carry with me at all times, isn’t it like i still have a companion?

if i love you
like i loved you from afar

i’m not too gone to be
healed, am i?
i’m not too gone
am i?

and if i am a cloud, then you are the sun
shining light on the darkness, even when the day is done

i’ve been big and small, and big and small, and big and small again
and still nobody wants me

i will see you fly away
while in my head you hold me dear
and whirl me off my feet of clay

i’ve been thinking about the patience of ordinary things, how clothes wait respectfully in closets and soap dries quietly in the dish, and towels drink the wet from the skin of the back. and the lovely repetition of stairs. and what is more generous than a window?

i wish you’d hold my hand
when i was upset
i wish you’d never forget
the look on my face when we first met

i will take good care of you
i will take good care of you
everything you feel is good
if you would only let you

is the tree as it rises delighted with its many branches, like a poem?
are the clouds glad to unburden their bundles of rain?
most of the world says no, no, it’s not possible.
i refuse to think such a conclusion.
too terrible it would be, to be wrong.
what would change if you fell in love?
i’m neither beautiful nor admirable. i’m tired and i’m bruised.

i’d like to walk around in your mind someday
i’d like to walk all over the things you say to me
i mean, isn’t that what most of us want in the end? to have someone not look away?

i wish that without me your heart would break
yeah, i wish that without me you’d be spending the rest of your nights awake
i wish that without me you couldn’t eat
yeah, i wish i was the last thing on your mind before you went to sleep
wish i was worth it to you.

the only trick of friendship is to find people who are better than you are–not smarter, not cooler, but kinder, and more generous and forgiving–and then to appreciate them for what they can teach you, and to trust them, which is the hardest thing of all. but the best, as well.
i wanted to be by your side, pushing you forward when i can. but now, just how far ahead of me are you?

to love life, to love it even
when you have no stomach for it
just close your eyes. i will still be here when you open them again.

i think it’s brave. i think it’s brave that you get up in the morning when your heart aches and life is messy and you do not feel like being soft for the world. i think it is brave that you continue to love and express and open your soul.

listen, everyone has a chance. is it spring, is it morning? are there trees near you, and does your own soul need comforting? quick, then—open the door and fly on your heavy feet; the song may already be drifting away.
i don’t care how many people might hate you or find you off-putting. i think you’re wonderful and i will always love you.
but It Cannot Be A Mistake to have cared … It Cannot Be An Error to have tried … It Cannot Be Incorrect to have loved
i want to know… do i dance inside your head?
you remind me of better times.

“i don’t know what’s going to come out of me,” i told her. “it has to be perfect. it has to be irreproachable in every way.”
“why?”
“to make up for it,” i said. “to make up for the fact that it’s me.”

why did you come here, to this place, if not in the hope of being understood, of being in some small way comprehended by your peers, and embraced by them in a fellowship of shared secrets?
i don’t know about you, but i just want to be held.
i could have oatmeal for breakfast, and oatmeal for lunch, oatmeal for dinner as well, at the sound of a bell!
...bright sunlight can also be very sad, have you noticed?

anything that is beautiful people want to break
and you are beautiful, i’m afraid
no, not me! i-i’m the pumpkin full of seeds. this big round cake looks sweeter than sweets. could the cake be madoka?
i am a mosaic of everyone i’ve ever loved, even for a heartbeat.

in order not to worry, you write the words down
but it’s a fool’s game and your game face is shameful
i will rewrite this whole life and this time there’ll be so much love, you won’t be able to see beyond it.

have i lived enough?
have i loved enough?
have i experienced happiness with sufficient gratitude?
have i endured loneliness with grace?
everything remained unspoken.
i stare into my tomato soup and think of my week: have my words been kind, sincere? has my language been filled with care? has the love i feel carried over?
and you play along because you want to die for love. you always have.

you do not have to be good.
you do not have to walk on your knees
for a hundred miles through the desert repenting.

i, i, i, i want to walk in the snow
and not leave a footprint
i, i, i, i want to walk in the snow
and not soil its purity

oh, we’ll be old and weary friends
god bless, let all this never end
if i don’t try to save myself, i’ll drown.
you listen and you know you could live a better life than you do, be softer, kinder.
i wasn’t beautiful anymore. now i looked like what i was, a raw wound.
i never stopped loving you. i hope you’re well.

for weeks now, driving, or dropping a bag of groceries in the street, the bag breaking,
i’ve been thinking: this is what the living do.

i am deeply in love with the mundanities of human life. i look at the street sign by my house that’s upside down, my neighbors who leave their christmas lights up all year. and i feel deeply enamored with existence.

everyday, my oatmeal routine
life would have rhythm!
and maybe harmony

but most of all i’d like you to be unaware
then i’d just wander away, trailing palm leaves behind me
so you don’t even know that i’ve been there

i’m manifesting love and fate
i am a man and i confess i’m fake
when i go hungry, i go nail and tooth
when i go hungry, i go hungry, i go hungry for the truth!
you’re the only friend i need.

i spent all my teenage years being obsessed with beauty. i’m very resentful about it and i’m very angry. i had so much intelligence and energy and drive and i directed all that fire inward and burnt myself up and tried to make myself beautiful and perfect.

and i guess it doesn’t matter what i am or pretend to be
‘cause it’s her you’ll always love and it’s her i’ll always envy

allow me to sit in the sun and listen to the sky. i will love you gently.
allow me to stay in my room and weave my rainbows. i will love you truly.

i loved my friend.
he went away from me.
there’s nothing more to say.
the poem ends,
soft as it began—
i loved my friend.

i will wash your hair at night
and dry it off with care
i will see your body bare
and still i will live here

i’d like to walk around in your mind someday
i’d like to walk all over the things you say to me

i wish you’d hold my hand
when i was upset
i wish you’d never forget
the look on my face when we first met
i know you still have wings. you will fly again, once you believe there is a goal to fly towards.

from a young age her life has been abnormal, she knows that. but so much is covered over in time now, the way leaves fall and cover a piece of earth, and eventually mingle with the soil. things that happened to her then are buried in the earth of her body.

mom, am i still young?
can i dream for a few months more?
in the dream i don’t tell anyone, you put your head in my lap.

sorry i don’t want your touch
it’s not that i don’t want you
sorry i can’t take your touch

i’ve waited so long to tell you
i’m sorry that now i’m holding out
but how heavy is my happiness that no sound on earth can encompass it?
i still wake up with things to tell you.
have a conversation with this emptiness. then treat yourself to openness with life, something new, something gentle. even a small thing. fill yourself up with lots of small loves for the world.
the number of hours we have together is actually not so large. please linger near the door uncomfortably instead of just leaving. please forget your scarf in my life and come back later for it.
sometimes i really believe it, that i am going to save my life a little.
but It Cannot Be A Mistake to have cared … It Cannot Be An Error to have tried … It Cannot Be Incorrect to have loved
it is a way of saying: being alive is worthwhile for its own sake because i make it so.

what i want from the river is what i always want:
to be held by a stronger thing that, in the end, chooses mercy.

on some level i think i always understood
that a ship could never really love an anchor
i wanted to be loved more than i wanted to be alive.
i just want such a humble, murderously simple thing: that a person be glad when i walk into a room.

anything that is beautiful people want to break
and you are beautiful, i’m afraid
i’d still throw myself mouth-open into the ocean for the chance to drown somewhere you might see it.

don’t waste your life on me my love
live and breathe the way you do
no butterfly to be pinned down
and kept forever through and through
so when things are terrible, hold onto the fact that someday, possibly when you least expect it, you’ll suddenly come across something wonderful!

‘cause we’ve tried hungry and we’ve tried full and
nothing seems enough

she rested her head against his and felt, for the first time, what she would often feel with him: a self-affection. he made her like herself. with him, she was at ease; her skin felt as though it was her right size.
maybe it’s myself that i miss. the field, and the sparrow singing at the edge of the woods.

someone to watch me die

we all long for loving community. it enhances life’s joy. but many of us seek community solely to escape the fear of being alone. knowing how to be solitary is central to the art of loving. when we can be alone, we can be with others without using them as a means of escape.
just close your eyes. i will still be here when you open them again.

i want to be a sweetheart in every moment, as charming as a hill with a small village on it. i want to be a village full of sweethearts, as you are, every second of the day, cooking me soups and drawing me pictures and holding me, with your infinite arms.
every day trying to make up for the one before
i am a mosaic of everyone i’ve ever loved, even for a heartbeat.
i love you. i miss you. the back door will always be unlocked if you ever feel like coming home.
may flowers grow in the saddest parts of you.
